documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Summary of Changes table to Section 8, detailing procedures for US screening sites mentioned in a footnote to Table 1.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to the COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Mitigation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation as a mitigation strategy for potential risks like transaminase elevations and anemia.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Design Features
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4, which describes the adaptive features of the study design.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 7, which outlines the criteria for decreasing or interrupting the study dose.

documentContentReferences.name: Blood Donation Exclusion
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) to the exclusion criteria in Section 5.2 regarding blood donation.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Method Guidance
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 to Section 10.4 for a description of appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Method Start Times
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 to the inclusion criteria in Section 5.1 regarding start times for contraceptive use.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Data Collection
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the SoA for data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Criteria
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Section 8.2.6 regarding pregnancy as a reason for discontinuation from study intervention.

documentContentReferences.name: QTc Withdrawal Criteria
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Discontinuation of Study Intervention and Participant Discontinuation/Withdrawal
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Laboratory Test List
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.4 to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: AE and SAE Procedures
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3 to Section 10.3 for procedures on recording, evaluating, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 to Section 7.3 for the definition of 'lost to follow-up'.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Policy
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 to Section 8.7, confirming that biobanked samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: Sample Collection Schedule
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Sections 8.5 and 8.6 to the SoA (Table 1) for the schedule of pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic sample collection.

documentContentReferences.name: Molybdenum Measurement Details
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 to Section 8.1.1 for details on molybdenum measurement in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Biomarker Details
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.8 to Section 8.6 for details on pharmacodynamic biomarkers like total copper and ceruloplasmin.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 9.3 to Table 8, which defines the population sets used for statistical analyses.

commentAnnotations.text: Medical Monitor Name and Contact Information can be found in the Study Contact List.
Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigatorâ€™s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
Reference to the Investigator's Brochure (IB) for data on ALXN1840 and ammonium tetrathiomolybdate studies.
Reference to the current Investigator's Brochure (IB) for nonclinical data on copper elimination.
Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Current protocol version, clarifying study procedures for US sites to facilitate recruitment.
The first approved version of the protocol.
